sentences.english: The john by the morning market is always dirty.
sentences.chinese: 早市旁邊的廁所總是不乾淨。

sentences.english: Hu Xuebing is on his way to the county town. He needs to sell his tofu at the morning market.
sentences.chinese: 胡學兵正趕往縣城，他要在早市上賣掉今天的豆腐。

sentences.english: The laid-off worker set up a vegetable stall in the morning market.
sentences.chinese: 這個下崗工人在早市上支起了一個菜攤。

sentences.english: One morning stroll already became a lot of Beijing's habits.
sentences.chinese: 逛早市已成爲許多北京人的習慣。

sentences.english: Many people in Peking have made morning shopping a hobby.
sentences.chinese: 逛早市已成爲許多北京人的習慣。

sentences.english: In early trading in Tokyo, the dollar fell sharply against the yen.
sentences.chinese: 在東京市場早市開盤時，美元對日元的比價急劇下跌。

sentences.english: The attack took place as the market was thronged with morning shoppers.
sentences.chinese: 襲擊發生時，市場上早市購物者熙熙攘攘。

sentences.english: It was in a morning that I went to morning market with my mother, selling fruit.
sentences.chinese: 那是在一個早晨，我和我的母親一起去了早市賣水果。

definition: to set up a vendor's stall in the street
to go to market/to go to a fair
